discussion.content:
A. Result catching has been disabled for the business service.
B. The WSDL resource for the business service has been updated. 

https://community.oracle.com/thread/2508706?tstart=0

questions.question_text:
Results catching has been configured on a business service. A previously cached result has been flushed from the cache.
Which two events may have occurred?

choices.A: Result catching has been disabled for the business service.
choices.C: The back-end service referenced by the endpoint URI has become unavailable.
choices.B: The WSDL resource for the business service has been updated.
choices.D: The back-end service has returned a different response for the cache key.

questions.question_text:
Given the following XML document, which two XPath expressions return the same result?
<?xml version ="1.0" encoding ="UTF – 8"?>
<bookstore>
<book category="COOKING">
<title lang="en">Everyday Italian Treats</title>
<author>George Smith</author>
<year>2009</year>
<price>30.00</price>
</book>
<book category="WEB">
<title lang="en">Getting Started with XPath</title>
<author>Tammy Lee</author>
<author>SergieLadloff</author>
<year>2011</year>
<price>49.99</price>
</book>
</bookstore>

After a successful web application login, an Oracle Access Manager (OAM) token is made available to Oracle WebLogic Server (WLS) where the token is asserted for authentication purposes. The resulting Java Authentication and Authorization Service (JAAS) subject is then made available to the Oracle Web
Service Manager (OWSM) agent where it is used to create a Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML).
Which security feature does this scenario illustrate?
Which three statements are true about the Oracle Enterprise Scheduler Service (ESS) facility?

choices.D: On the scheduling service home page, you can quickly find a list of the 10 job requests that have been running for the longest period of time.
choices.A: An ESS job request processor is responsible for allocating threads for job requests.
choices.C: A WebLogic cluster must be established because ESS cannot run on just a single node.
choices.E: ESS is used internally by SOA Suite and you typically don’t use it to schedule your own jobs.
choices.B: An ESS job request dispatcher polls for job requests and invoked jobs.

discussion.content:
A. An ESS job request processor is responsible for allocating threads for job requests.
B. An ESS job request dispatcher polls for job requests and invoked jobs.
D. On the scheduling service home page, you can quickly find a list of the 10 job requests that have been running for the longest period of time.

questions.question_text:
To support the deployment of a new provisioning system, a company wants to install and configure a production domain with Oracle SOA Suite and Oracle
Service Bus.
Which statement is true about the required effort?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer D (check SOA Suite 12c Exam Study Guide)
D. A supported version of WebLogic Server must be installed before installing Oracle SOA Suite.

choices.D: A supported version of WebLogic Server must be installed before installing Oracle SOA Suite.
choices.B: The Oracle Repository Creation Utility (RCU) must be run twice to create the required schemas.
choices.C: The installation of Oracle SOA Suite includes the installation of Oracle Service Bus.
choices.A: Separate domains must be configured for Oracle SOA Suite and Oracle Service Bus.
